title: The Way of the Heart is perfect, like vast space where nothing is lacking and nothing is in excess. ...

attachments.displayName:
The Way of the Heart is perfect, like vast space where nothing is lacking and nothing is in excess. Indeed, it is due to our choosing to accept or reject that we do not see the true nature of things. Live neither in the entanglements of outer things, nor in inner feelings of emptiness. Be serene in the oneness of things, and such erroneous views will disappear by themselves. When you try to stop activity to achieve peace, your very effort disrupts your peace. As long as you remain in one extreme or the other, you will never know Oneness.
- Sosan, tr. Ramgiri

Photo credit: Robin Halioua
